data.title: Online Romanian movies subtitled
data.meta_description: CINEPUB is the most complete archive platform of Romanian movies online. Watch online Romanian short films, Romanian documentaries, Romanian feature films and Romanian animations.
data.text:
BEYOND THE SANDS (1974) – drama movie online

“Beyond the Sands” reveals an intense Balkan saga, with road-movie and coming-of-age overtones, in a local convention of outlaw movies. Revenge and disillusionment are constant themes throughout and dictate the film’s subsidiary force, set against a gray swampy landscape near Braila.

Directed by: Radu Gabrea

Script: Fănuș Neagu, adapted from the novel „The Angel Cried Out”

Cast: Dan Nuțu, George Constantin, Mircea Albulescu, Emil Botta, Gina Patrichi, Violeta Andrei, Vasile Nițulescu, Gheorghe Dinică, Ernst Maftei, Constantin Rauțchi, Ștefan Mihăilescu-Brăila

THE RETURN OF KING LĂPUȘNEANU (1980) – historic movie online

Can we see in the rule and cruelty of Alexandru Lăpușneanu a sketch of Nicolae Ceaușescu? We are tempted to follow this line of interpretation when Lăpușneanu orders Moțoc: “let no bird enter Moldavia”, then adds, after a moment of silence, “and let no bird go out either”.

The film is, rather, a chronicle of a long tradition in the architecture of power in Romania, of the hierarchy of local barons that ends up being overpowered by the dictatorship; and the dictator, in turn, eventually being killed by the boyars who will put on the throne another victim of their own hubris.

Directed by: Malvina Urșianu

Script: Malvina Urșianu

Cast: George Motoi, Silvia Popovici, Cornel Coman, Valeiu Paraschiv, Eugenia Bosânceanu, Melania Ursu, Ion Niciu, Eusebiu Ștefănescu, Mihail Vasile Boghiță, Gheorghe Buznea, Dumitru Crăciun, Ion Crăciun, Mircea Cruceanu, Nicolae Dide, Valeria Gagealov, Silvia Ghelan, Cornel Ispas

SILENT RIVER (2011) – drama film online

“Silent River” reminds us of a period, which we can leave behind with a sigh of relief, where local discourse strained to extract every dysfunctional aspect of the past and exploit it dramatically. The distance from the obsessions of the past allows a new perspective of the present, a clear one, with the same type of critical eye, but less sure of the sum of its conclusions, with which we look at eras that do not belong to us directly.

Thus, we can allow ourselves to look at the world we live in, seemingly so volatile and sensitive to any form of criticism, as if we were looking at Antiquity, the Renaissance, or, why not, the years before the fall of the socialist regime.

Directed by: Anca Miruna Lăzărescu

Script: Anca Miruna Lăzărescu

Cast: Toma Cuzin, Andi Vasluianu, Patricia Moga, Marius Ursu, Branko Tomociv

A MIDSUMMER DAY’S SMILE (1964) – comedy movie online

Făniță (Sebastian Papaiani) is a merchant or, as we would say today, an entrepreneur. Where there’s a field of flowers, he sees beehives; where there’s a fair, he sees a doughnut stand; where there’s a road, he sees a carriage to carry people.

The villagers keep pulling him to come up with his ideas for the collective farm, but he won’t and won’t. Făniță is intoxicated by the capitalism dream, and the movie is at pains to point out that his ambition is possible under communism – that is, not outlawed; but it is, however, a little impossible.

Directed by: Geo Saizescu

Script: Dumitru Radu Popescu

Cast: Sebastian Papaiani, Dem Rădulescu, Draga Olteanu Matei, Puiu Călinescu, Melania Cârje, George Constantin, Rodica Mandache, Florina Lucian, Dumitru Furdui, Matei Alexandru, Nineta Gusti, Nucu Păunescu, Silvia Fulda, Eugenia Giurgiu Papaiani, Domnica Pellea, Liviu Crăciun, Catița Ispas, Dumitrel Cucereanu, Aurelia Rucăreanu

FLEETING LOVES (1974) – romantic movie online

The emotional core of the movie is a heavy state that constantly weighs on the main characters; a state stemming from a deep sense of abandonment. The movie’s running time is long, charged with a deadly poetry.

But who among those who have experienced, at least transiently, the feeling of abandonment and helplessness, would not say that it comes with a feeling of enormous time dilation, a slow and unstoppable process, like the hardening of a concrete formwork?

Directed by: Malvina Urșianu

Script: Malvina Urșianu

Cast: George Motoi, Silvia Popovici, Gina Patrichi, Cornel Coman, Nina Costa, Mihai Pălădescu, Emilia Dobrin, Maria Cumbari, Iulian Vișa, Mihaela Nestorescu, Delia Mateescu, Iulian Necșulescu, Sorin Gabor, Ion Niciu, Dorel Vișan, Rodica Platzman, Beate Fredanov

THROUGH THE ASHES OF THE EMPIRE (1976) – war movie online

The supreme charlatan befriends the good, warm-hearted young man, absorbing him completely and, at the same time, following him, as if he is just learning to take his first steps; but he never confesses. He “knows” all about the world. He talks as if he invented it. In fact, he knows nothing.

Directed by: Andrei Blaier

Script: Andrei Blaier, Zaharia Stancu (film inspired by his novel „A Gamble with Death”, 1962)

Cast: Gheorghe Dinică, Gabriel Oseciuc, Cornel Coman, Ștefan Sileanu, Ferenc Bencze, Ernest Maftei, Jean Reder, Constantin Rautchi, Theodor Pica, Nucu Păunescu, Petre Gheorghiu-Goe, Petruț Traian, Ion Porsilă, Anton Aftenie …
